   21: %%
   22: %% File:    os_signal_SUITE.erl
   23: %% Author:  Bj√∂rn-Egil Dahlberg
   24: %% Created: 2017-01-13
   25: %%
   26: 
   27: -module(os_signal_SUITE).
   28: 
   29: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   30: -export([all/0, suite/0]).
   31: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   32: -export([init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   33: 
   34: -export([set_alarm/1, fork/0, get_exit_code/1]).
   35: 
   36: % Test cases
   37: -export([set_unset/1,
   38:          t_sighup/1,
   39:          t_sigusr1/1,
   40:          t_sigusr2/1,
   41:          t_sigterm/1,
   42:          t_sigalrm/1,
   43:          t_sigchld/1,
   44:          t_sigchld_fork/1]).
   45: 
   46: -define(signal_server, erl_signal_server).
   47: 
   48: suite() ->
   49:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   50:      {timetrap, {minutes, 2}}].
   51: 
   52: all() ->
   53:     case os:type() of
   54:         {win32, _} -> [];
   55:         _ -> [t_sighup,
   56:               t_sigusr1,
   57:               t_sigusr2,
   58:               t_sigterm,
   59:               t_sigalrm,
   60:               t_sigchld,
   61:               t_sigchld_fork,
   62:               set_unset]
   63:     end.
   64: 
   65: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
   66:     Pid = erlang:whereis(?signal_server),
   67:     true = erlang:unregister(?signal_server),
   68:     [{signal_server, Pid}|Config].
   69: 
   70: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   71:     case proplists:get_value(signal_server, Config) of
   72:         undefined -> ok;
   73:         Pid ->
   74:             true = erlang:register(?signal_server, Pid),
   75:             ok
   76:     end.
   77: 
   78: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   79:     load_nif(Config),
   80:     Config.
   81: 
   82: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   83:     ok.
   84: 
   85: %% tests
   86: 
   87: set_unset(_Config) ->
   88:     Signals = [sighup, %sigint,
   89:                sigquit, %sigill,
   90:                sigabrt,
   91:                sigalrm, sigterm,
   92:                sigusr1, sigusr2,
   93:                sigchld,
   94:                sigstop, sigtstp],
   95:     F1 = fun(Sig) -> ok = os:set_signal(Sig,handle) end,
   96:     F2 = fun(Sig) -> ok = os:set_signal(Sig,default) end,
   97:     F3 = fun(Sig) -> ok = os:set_signal(Sig,ignore) end,
   98:     %% set handle
   99:     ok = lists:foreach(F1, Signals),
  100:     %% set ignore
  101:     ok = lists:foreach(F2, Signals),
  102:     %% set default
  103:     ok = lists:foreach(F3, Signals),
  104:     ok.
  105: 
  106: t_sighup(_Config) ->
  107:     Pid1 = setup_service(),
  108:     OsPid = os:getpid(),
  109:     os:set_signal(sighup, handle),
  110:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  111:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  112:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  113:     Msgs1 = fetch_msgs(Pid1),
  114:     io:format("Msgs1: ~p~n", [Msgs1]),
  115:     [{notify,sighup},
  116:      {notify,sighup},
  117:      {notify,sighup}] = Msgs1,
  118:     %% no proc
  119:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  120:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  121:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  122:     %% ignore
  123:     Pid2 = setup_service(),
  124:     os:set_signal(sighup, ignore),
  125:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  126:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  127:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  128:     Msgs2 = fetch_msgs(Pid2),
  129:     io:format("Msgs2: ~p~n", [Msgs2]),
  130:     [] = Msgs2,
  131:     %% reset to handle (it's the default)
  132:     os:set_signal(sighup, handle),
  133:     ok.
  134: 
  135: t_sigusr1(_Config) ->
  136:     Pid1 = setup_service(),
  137:     OsPid = os:getpid(),
  138:     % shouldn't need to explicitly set_signal to handle USR1, it's the default
  139:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  140:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  141:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  142:     Msgs1 = fetch_msgs(Pid1),
  143:     io:format("Msgs1: ~p~n", [Msgs1]),
  144:     [{notify,sigusr1},
  145:      {notify,sigusr1},
  146:      {notify,sigusr1}] = Msgs1,
  147:     %% no proc
  148:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  149:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  150:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  151:     %% ignore
  152:     Pid2 = setup_service(),
  153:     os:set_signal(sigusr1, ignore),
  154:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  155:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  156:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  157:     Msgs2 = fetch_msgs(Pid2),
  158:     io:format("Msgs2: ~p~n", [Msgs2]),
  159:     [] = Msgs2,
  160:     %% reset to handle (default) so as not to break other tests
  161:     os:set_signal(sigusr1, handle),
  162:     ok.
  163: 
  164: t_sigusr2(_Config) ->
  165:     Pid1 = setup_service(),
  166:     OsPid = os:getpid(),
  167:     os:set_signal(sigusr2, handle),
  168:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  169:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  170:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  171:     Msgs1 = fetch_msgs(Pid1),
  172:     io:format("Msgs1: ~p~n", [Msgs1]),
  173:     [{notify,sigusr2},
  174:      {notify,sigusr2},
  175:      {notify,sigusr2}] = Msgs1,
  176:     %% no proc
  177:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  178:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  179:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  180:     %% ignore
  181:     Pid2 = setup_service(),
  182:     os:set_signal(sigusr2, ignore),
  183:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  184:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  185:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  186:     Msgs2 = fetch_msgs(Pid2),
  187:     io:format("Msgs2: ~p~n", [Msgs2]),
  188:     [] = Msgs2,
  189:     %% reset to ignore (it's the default)
  190:     os:set_signal(sigusr2, ignore),
  191:     ok.
  192: 
  193: t_sigterm(_Config) ->
  194:     Pid1 = setup_service(),
  195:     OsPid = os:getpid(),
  196:     os:set_signal(sigterm, handle),
  197:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  198:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  199:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  200:     Msgs1 = fetch_msgs(Pid1),
  201:     io:format("Msgs1: ~p~n", [Msgs1]),
  202:     [{notify,sigterm},
  203:      {notify,sigterm},
  204:      {notify,sigterm}] = Msgs1,
  205:     %% no proc
  206:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  207:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  208:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  209:     %% ignore
  210:     Pid2 = setup_service(),
  211:     os:set_signal(sigterm, ignore),
  212:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  213:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  214:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  215:     Msgs2 = fetch_msgs(Pid2),
  216:     io:format("Msgs2: ~p~n", [Msgs2]),
  217:     [] = Msgs2,
  218:     %% reset to handle (it's the default)
  219:     os:set_signal(sigterm, handle),
  220:     ok.
  221: 
  222: t_sigchld(_Config) ->
  223:     Pid1 = setup_service(),
  224:     OsPid = os:getpid(),
  225:     os:set_signal(sigchld, handle),
  226:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  227:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  228:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  229:     Msgs1 = fetch_msgs(Pid1),
  230:     io:format("Msgs1: ~p~n", [Msgs1]),
  231:     [{notify,sigchld},
  232:      {notify,sigchld},
  233:      {notify,sigchld}] = Msgs1,
  234:     %% no proc
  235:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  236:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  237:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  238:     %% ignore
  239:     Pid2 = setup_service(),
  240:     os:set_signal(sigchld, ignore),
  241:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  242:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  243:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  244:     Msgs2 = fetch_msgs(Pid2),
  245:     io:format("Msgs2: ~p~n", [Msgs2]),
  246:     [] = Msgs2,
  247:     %% reset to handle (it's the default)
  248:     os:set_signal(sigchld, ignore),
  249:     ok.
  250: 
  251: 
  252: t_sigalrm(_Config) ->
  253:     Pid1 = setup_service(),
  254:     ok = os:set_signal(sigalrm, handle),
  255:     ok = os_signal_SUITE:set_alarm(1),
  256:     receive after 3000 -> ok end,
  257:     Msgs1 = fetch_msgs(Pid1),
  258:     [{notify,sigalrm}] = Msgs1,
  259:     io:format("Msgs1: ~p~n", [Msgs1]),
  260:     os:set_signal(sigalrm, ignore),
  261:     Pid2 = setup_service(),
  262:     ok = os_signal_SUITE:set_alarm(1),
  263:     receive after 3000 -> ok end,
  264:     Msgs2 = fetch_msgs(Pid2),
  265:     [] = Msgs2,
  266:     io:format("Msgs2: ~p~n", [Msgs2]),
  267:     Pid3 = setup_service(),
  268:     os:set_signal(sigalrm, handle),
  269:     ok = os_signal_SUITE:set_alarm(1),
  270:     receive after 3000 -> ok end,
  271:     Msgs3 = fetch_msgs(Pid3),
  272:     [{notify,sigalrm}] = Msgs3,
  273:     io:format("Msgs3: ~p~n", [Msgs3]),
  274:     os:set_signal(sigalrm, ignore),
  275:     ok.
  276: 
  277: t_sigchld_fork(_Config) ->
  278:     case test_server:is_asan() of
  279: 	true ->
  280: 	    %% Avoid false leak reports from forked process
  281: 	    {skip, "Address sanitizer"};
  282: 	false ->
  283: 	    sigchld_fork()
  284:     end.
  285: 
  286: sigchld_fork() ->
  287:     Pid1 = setup_service(),
  288:     ok = os:set_signal(sigchld, handle),
  289:     {ok,OsPid} = os_signal_SUITE:fork(),
  290:     receive after 3000 -> ok end,
  291:     Msgs1 = fetch_msgs(Pid1),
  292:     io:format("Msgs1: ~p~n", [Msgs1]),
  293:     [{notify,sigchld}] = Msgs1,
  294:     {ok,Status} = os_signal_SUITE:get_exit_code(OsPid),
  295:     io:format("exit status from ~w : ~w~n", [OsPid,Status]),
  296:     42 = Status,
  297:     %% reset to ignore (it's the default)
  298:     os:set_signal(sigchld, ignore),
  299:     ok.
  300: 
  301: 
  302: %% nif stubs
  303: 
  304: set_alarm(_Secs) -> no.
  305: fork() -> no.
  306: get_exit_code(_OsPid) -> no.
  307: 
  308: %% aux
  309: 
  310: setup_service() ->
  311:     Pid = spawn_link(fun msgs/0),
  312:     true = erlang:register(?signal_server, Pid),
  313:     Pid.
  314: 
  315: msgs() ->
  316:     msgs([]).
  317: msgs(Ms) ->
  318:     receive
  319:         {Pid, fetch_msgs} -> Pid ! {self(), lists:reverse(Ms)};
  320:         Msg ->
  321:             msgs([Msg|Ms])
  322:     end.
  323: 
  324: fetch_msgs(Pid) ->
  325:     Pid ! {self(), fetch_msgs},
  326:     receive {Pid, Msgs} -> Msgs end.
  327: 
  328: kill(Signal, Pid) ->
  329:     {0,_} = run("kill", ["-s", Signal, Pid]),
  330:     receive after 200 -> ok end,
  331:     ok.
  332: 
  333: load_nif(Config) ->
  334:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  335:     case erlang:load_nif(filename:join(Path,"os_signal_nif"), 0) of
  336:         ok -> ok;
  337:         {error,{reload,_}} -> ok
  338:     end.
  339: 
  340: run(Program0, Args) -> run(".", Program0, Args).
  341: run(Cwd, Program0, Args) when is_list(Cwd) ->
  342:     Program = case os:find_executable(Program0) of
  343:                   Path when is_list(Path) ->
  344:                       Path;
  345:                   false ->
  346:                       exit(no)
  347:               end,
  348:     Options = [{args,Args},binary,exit_status,stderr_to_stdout,
  349:                {line,4096}, {cd, Cwd}],
  350:     try open_port({spawn_executable,Program}, Options) of
  351:         Port ->
  352:             run_loop(Port, [])
  353:     catch
  354:         error:_ ->
  355:                       exit(no)
  356:     end.
  357: 
  358: run_loop(Port, Output) ->
  359:     receive
  360:         {Port,{exit_status,Status}} ->
  361:             {Status,lists:reverse(Output)};
  362:         {Port,{data,{eol,Bin}}} ->
  363:             run_loop(Port, [Bin|Output]);
  364:         _Msg ->
  365:             run_loop(Port, Output)
  366:     end.
